messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/27/02 8:35:26 PM Central Daylight Time, ... We LOVE Mad Libs! We get them at a local toy store, in packs. If you can t find them where you
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/27/02 8:35:26 PM Central Daylight Time,
Hatfield72@... writes:


> nybody know if Mad Libs are still around? I thought they might be
> a fun and painless way for my son to learn about nouns, etc.
>
> Thanks in advance
>
> Tina (inmdcrew)
>

We LOVE Mad Libs! We get them at a local toy store, in packs. If you can't
find them where you are, let me know, I will be glad to send you some.
~Nancy

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Mad Libs
messages.msgSnippet: To be, or not to twirl, -- that is the guitar; Whether tis nobler in the nose to suffer The slings and fish of giggling fortune, Or to take shoes against a
messages.messageBody:
To be, or not to twirl, -- that is the guitar;
Whether 'tis nobler in the nose to suffer
The slings and fish of giggling fortune,
Or to take shoes against a sea of whiskers,
And by singing end them. To die, -- to dance, --
No more; and by a dance to say we end
The dog and the forty-five natural shocks
That flesh is cousin to,-- 'tis a Toronto
cooly to be wish'd. To die, --- to dance,--
To dance! perchance to grind! ay, there's the truck;
For in that dance of death what flowers may come
When we have smelled off this lovely coil,
Must give us garden....

http://www.madlibs.org/

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Mad Libs
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/27/02 9:34:44 PM, Hatfield72@Hotmail.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/27/02 9:34:44 PM, Hatfield72@... writes:

<< Anybody know if Mad Libs are still around? I thought they might be
a fun and painless way for my son to learn about nouns, etc.

Thanks in advance

Tina (inmdcrew) >>


My kids love Mad Libs. I bought a bunch of them a few years ago, I think at a
Target store.

You can also go here:

http://www.mit.edu/storyfun
http://www.eduplace.com/tales/
http://www.funbrain.com/wacky/

and do Mad Libs online.

Have fun!

Sharon

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Mad Libs
messages.msgSnippet: ... Emphatically, YES!  You can easily get them at Amazon.  We have such a great time using Mad Libs.  Parts of speech is definitely a bonus, but they are so
messages.messageBody:
At 01:34 8/28/02 +0000, Tina wrote:
>Anybody know if Mad Libs are still around? I thought they might be
>a fun and painless way for my son to learn about nouns, etc.
>
>Thanks in advance
>
>Tina (inmdcrew)

Emphatically, YES! You can easily get them at Amazon. We have such a
great time using Mad Libs. Parts of speech is definitely a bonus, but they
are so much fun, who cares? <g>

marji

a fun and painless way for my son to learn about nouns, etc.
